summary: Successfully completed comprehensive cursor rules enhancement. Cloned awesome-cursorrules repository (170+ templates), explored React Native Expo, Python FastAPI, TypeScript React, and Git conventions rules. Created enhanced .cursorrules file combining best practices from multiple templates with existing ERPNext/Frappe standards. Added comprehensive documentation in AWESOME_CURSORRULES_EXPLORATION.md covering project structure, naming conventions, type safety, testing, performance, and security patterns. All rules now aligned with industry best practices while maintaining ERPNext v15+ compatibility.
current_status: Project now has: (1) Enhanced .cursorrules file with 12 major sections covering ERPNext/Frappe, Python, React Native Expo, TypeScript, Git conventions, API integration, testing, and documentation standards. (2) Two cloned reference repositories: mcp-servers-repo (70+ MCP servers) and awesome-cursorrules-repo (170+ cursor rules). (3) Comprehensive exploration document detailing all relevant patterns, implementation checklists, and success metrics. Ready to apply these enhanced rules to improve code quality and AI assistance throughout the project.
